properties.Title: Civil Emergency, Update From Sk Provincial Emergency Communications Centre
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.
Expires: 2021-01-20T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2021-01-06T11:45:22-06:00, AC875D54-540E-14B0-4AE5-AEB7B7DA08E6
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow will continue until Friday evening. Total Snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Location: Upper Lake Melville. Remarks: The system affecting southeastern Labrador has pushed further west than previously expected, as a result higher snowfall amounts are now expected in the area. Snow is expected to be heaviest tonight with lighter amounts both during the day today and Friday. Ice pellets are also likely to mix in with the snow at times, especially tonight. Northerly winds gusting up to 50 km/h may cause reduced visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas at times. Conditions are expected to improve by Friday evening as snowfall intensity begins to diminish. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:07:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:08:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2889856559.2021
Area: Upper Lake Melville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of mixed winter weather is forecast for the latter half of this week. Locations: southeastern Labrador. Total rainfall through Friday night: 20 to 40 mm along the coast Cartwright and south. Snow and ice pellets amounts: near 20 cm tonight through Thursday night in the Eagle River area, with less than 10 cm over higher terrain of the Cartwright area. Time span: continuing through Friday. Remarks: Snow and ice pellets have changed over to rain along the coast south of Black Tickle. Freezing rain is expected for higher elevations of the Trans-Labrador Highway. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-07T19:08:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T03:09:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1172859491.2021
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected this evening over the Natashquan region. Ice accretion amounts of 2 to 4 millimetres are expected. Precipitation will change over to snow overnight tonight. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:01:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:02:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3006197325.2021
Area: Natashquan
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected to continue until Friday morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:29:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:30:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1077812700.2021
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected to continue. Locations: southeastern Labrador. Time span: continuing into Friday. Remarks: While most coastal communities will now only receive rain during this event, freezing rain is forecast to continue for higher elevations of the Trans-Labrador Highway. While it is not certain what the impacts of such a long period of icing will be, there is certainly potential for heavy ice build up in some areas after more than 24 hours of freezing rain. Along the coast, 20 to 30 mm of rain is expected by Friday evening. While this is forecast to remain just below rainfall warning criteria, some localized flooding will be possible due to the rain combining with snow melt runoff. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Utility outages may occur. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:07:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:08:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0910276420.2021
Area: Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions will affect these communities beginning this evening through Friday. The snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero. Protect yourself from the wind, the cold and disorientation by staying safely inside. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:14:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:15:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0316632526.2021
Area: Ivujivik, Akulivik, Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog have developed in southwest Manitoba. These areas of fog are expected to persist for most of the night with gradually improving visibilities through the day on Thursday. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-07T19:19:47-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system moving through Haida Gwaii is bringing very strong southeast winds over the exposed coastal sections of the North Coast and Haida Gwaii. Southeast winds of 90 km/h are occurring. Winds will ease to below warning criteria later this morning. However, yet another powerful system developing offshore is set to bring very strong southeasterly winds to coastal sections of the north coast and Haida Gwaii again tonight. Once again southeast winds of 90 km/h are expected to develop before Friday morning. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T04:38:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T12:39:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3278200732.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 30 to 50 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northerly 60 to 70 km/h. Locations: the mid Labrador coast from Rigolet to Makkovik. Time span: continuing until Friday evening. Remarks: The snow will persist through today and Friday, with significant accumulations expected. The snow will combine with strengthening northerly winds to produce blowing snow, especially over exposed areas, today. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:07:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:08:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0274772909.2021
Area: Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Near 25 cm of snow between Pleasant Camp and the Chilkat Pass today and tonight. A weather system will move across northwestern B.C. on Thursday generating heavy snow south of the Chilkat Pass on the Haines Road. The heaviest period is likely this afternoon and evening. Snow will end early Friday morning as the system moves out of the area. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T05:39:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T13:40:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3909029877.2021
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions are expected tonight in Sanirajak and Igloolik as an approaching low pressure system brings snow and very strong southerly winds. Winds will ease somewhat Friday morning resulting in somewhat improved visibility. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:20:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:21:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3244567542.2021
Area: Sanirajak, Igloolik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of blowing snow is expected. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: continuing until Friday evening. Remarks: Strong northerly winds gusting between 70 and 90 km/h will combine with 15 to 20 cm of new snow to produce very poor visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve by Friday evening as the snow begins to taper off and winds begin to diminish. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:13:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:14:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0398680533.2021
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southerly winds will reach near 100 kilometres per hour beginning this afternoon. These high winds will last through Friday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T01:15:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-07T09:16:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3126500704.2021
Area: Salluit
